articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court on Monday said it had requested arrest warrants against Israeli Prime Minisiter Benjamin Netanyahu and Denfense Minister Yoav Gallant for alledged war crimes in Gaza.
articles.title: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu and Defense Minister Gallant

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Yomna Mohamed
articles.description: Hopes are fading that Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and his foreign minister have survived a helicopter crash in mountainous terrain and icy weather, an Iranian official said on Monday after search teams located the wreckage.
articles.title: Iranian President Raisi feared dead as helicopter wreckage found

articles.author: Mike Collett-White, Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Western allies are taking too long to make key decisions on military support for Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy told Reuters in an exclusive interview in Kyiv on Monday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Western aid to Ukraine too slow, risks from U.S. election limited, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Michael Holden, Sam Tobin
articles.description: A British court could give a final decision on Monday on whether WikiLeaks' founder Julian Assange should be extradited to the United States over the mass leak of secret U.S. documents, the culmination of 13 years of legal battles and detentions.
articles.title: WikiLeaks' Julian Assange faces US extradition judgment day

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden strongly defended Israel on Monday, saying Israeli forces are not committing genocide in their military campaign against Hamas militants in Gaza in a rejection of criticism from pro-Palestinian protesters.
articles.title: Biden: What's happening in Gaza is not genocide

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Gaza Strip residents criticised on Monday the International Criminal Court prosecutor's decision to seek the arrest of Hamas leaders, saying it falsely equated them with the Israeli leaders waging war in the Palestinian enclave since October.
articles.title: Gazans, Hamas see false equivalence in ICC charges

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Lucy Craymer
articles.description: Australia and New Zealand said they will send government planes to New Caledonia on Tuesday to evacuate nationals from the French territory which has experienced a week of deadly riots, sparked by electoral changes by the French government in Paris.
articles.title: Australia, New Zealand send evacuation flights to New Caledonia

articles.author: Michelle McLoughlin, Steve Gorman
articles.description: Scores of graduating students staged a walkout from Yale University's commencement exercises on Monday, protesting the Israeli war in Gaza, Yale's financial ties to weapons makers and its response to pro-Palestinian demonstrations on the Ivy League campus.
articles.title: Yale graduates stage pro-Palestinian walkout of commencement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Solomon Islands' newly elected Prime Minister Jeremiah Manele said the Pacific Island nation was ready to discuss "much, much larger bilateral co-operation" with Australia, as the latter's Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles visited on Tuesday.
articles.title: Solomon Islands tells Australia it remains partner of choice

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Benjamin Netanyahu was one of the most polarising leaders in Israel's history long before the International Criminal Court prosecutor's office said on Monday it had requested an arrest warrant against him over possible war crimes in Gaza.
articles.title: Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel's divisive leader in the eye of the ICC storm
